public class SqliteBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Implementation of SqlBuilder for interacting with a SQLite database.

createTables

public int createTables(SqliteDbHelper dbHelper)
                 throws ModelConfigurationException,
                        InfinitumConfigurationException
Description copied from interface: SqlBuilder
Creates the model tables for the application in the SQLite database as configured in infinitum.cfg.xml and returns the numbers of tables created.

Specified by:
createTables in interface SqlBuilder
Parameters:
dbHelper - the SqliteDbHelper encapsulating the InfinitumContext for this application
Returns:
number of tables created
Throws:
ModelConfigurationException - if table(s) cannot be created due to a misconfigured model. For example, a model that does not contain any persistent Fields
InfinitumConfigurationException - if domain classes have not been properly configured in infinitum.cfg.xml

createManyToManyJoinQuery

public java.lang.String createManyToManyJoinQuery(ManyToManyRelationship rel,
                                                  java.io.Serializable id,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?> direction)
                                           throws InfinitumRuntimeException
Description copied from interface: SqlBuilder
Generates a SQL query String from the given ManyToManyRelationship which retrieves rows of the given direction type which are associated with the given ID.

For example, assume you have the models Foo and Bar which have a many-to-many association and are mapped to the tables foo and bar respectively with the relationships being stored in foobar. Calling createManyToManyJoinQuery(rel, 42, Bar.class) would generate a query that would retrieve all records of Bar associated with the instance of Foo which has an ID of 42.

Specified by:
createManyToManyJoinQuery in interface SqlBuilder
Parameters:
rel - the ManyToManyRelationship containing the association being queried
id - the ID in which the associated records are linked with
direction - the direction the relationship is being queried in, returning records of this Class
Returns:
SQL query
Throws:
InfinitumRuntimeException - if the direction Class is not a part of the given ManyToManyRelationship

createInitialStaleRelationshipQuery

public java.lang.StringBuilder createInitialStaleRelationshipQuery(ManyToManyRelationship rel,
                                                                   java.lang.Object model)
Description copied from interface: SqlBuilder
Generates a StringBuilder consisting of the initial segment of a SQL query for deleting stale many-to-many relationships.

For example: DELETE FROM foo_bar WHERE foo_id = 42 AND bar_id NOT IN (. The NOT IN clause is intended to be populated with the IDs of entities which are currently related to the Foo entity with ID 42, typically using SqlBuilder.addPrimaryKeyToQuery(Object, StringBuilder, String) . Thus, the completed query will be used to clear relationships which no longer exist.

Specified by:
createInitialStaleRelationshipQuery in interface SqlBuilder
Parameters:
rel - the ManyToManyRelationship for this relationship query
model - the model containing the relationship
Returns:
StringBuilder containing the initial query segment

addPrimaryKeyToQuery

public void addPrimaryKeyToQuery(java.lang.Object o,
                                 java.lang.StringBuilder sb,
                                 java.lang.String prefix)
Description copied from interface: SqlBuilder
Adds the given Object's primary key to the specified query. This method is the counterpart to SqlBuilder.createInitialStaleRelationshipQuery(ManyToManyRelationship, Object) and SqlBuilder.createInitialUpdateForeignKeyQuery(OneToManyRelationship, Object) as it is used to populate the IN or NOT IN clause of the query.

Specified by:
addPrimaryKeyToQuery in interface SqlBuilder
Parameters:
o - the Object whose primary key will be added to the query
sb - the StringBuilder containing the query
prefix - key prefix, usually "" or ", "
